Logical_source_description.0: Defense Meteorolgy Satellite Program F17 Vector Magnetometer Measurements (850km Altitude)

Acknowledgement.0: Data access provided by NGDC in coordination with AFRL and CU Boulder.

LINK_TEXT.0: NGDC Solar & Terrestrial Physics Satellite Data Services

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Earth Centered Inertial (ECI) spacecraft location (x,y,z) in km.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Epoch is True of Date (TOD). These ECI coordinates are calculated from an SPDF SSC Locator 1-minute ephemeris using an 8 order interpolation (Burden, R. L. and Faires, J. D., Numerical Analysis, 5th Ed., PWS Publishing Company, Boston, 1993). Using SPDF methods, expected accuracy is on the order of a few km.
Calculated using IDL Astro Library function eci2geo().
Calculated using IDL Astro Library function eci2geo().

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Distance from center of Earth in km.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Calculated using SuperDARN AACGM IDL library. Values are the result of linearly interpolating between 2 nearest AACGM 5-year epochs.
Calculated using SuperDARN AACGM IDL library. Values are the result of linearly interpolating between 2 nearest AACGM 5-year epochs.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Altitude Adjusted Corrected Geomagnetic Local Time

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Calculated using SuperDARN AACGM IDL library. Values are the result of linearly interpolating between 2 nearest AACGM 5-year epochs.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Original measured field (x,y,z) in nT in spacecraft frame.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X = Geodedic nadir (down).Y = Along Spacecraft Track (ram),.Z = Across-Track Right .NOTE: This pertrubations in this variable have been recomputed from the observed B-field.IGRF11 was run using this day as epoch and new, more accurate geocentric location was rotatedinto spacecraft coordinates and removed.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: delta-B (Original measured B - Modeled IGRF field) (x,y,z) in nT in spacecraft frame.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X = Geodedic nadir (down).Y = Along Spacecraft Track (ram),.Z = Across-Track Right

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Baseline Corrected delta-B in nT rotated into geocentric spherical (east-north-up) coordinates.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Finite difference between adjacent points on spacecraft track was used to determine along and across track unit vectors in GEO. No altitude change between adjacent points was assumed..Baseline correction (F. Rich's MFIT procedure) is polynomial fit every half-pass to each component of Delta-B in spacecraft coordinates using only data from region equatorward of DMSP auroral boundary from CEDAR Database.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Baseline Corrected delta-B in nT rotated into Modified Apex Coordinates with Reference Height 110 km.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Coordinates transformed with apex-python (NCAR HAO). Reference Altitude = 110km, see Richmond, J. Geomag. Geoelec. ,1995.Baseline correction (F. Rich's MFIT procedure) is polynomial fit every half-pass to each component of Delta-B in spacecraft coordinates using only data from region equatorward of DMSP auroral boundary from CEDAR Database.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Baseline Corrected delta-B in nT in spacecraft frame.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: X = Geodedic nadir (down), Y = Along Spacecraft Track (ram), Z = Across-Track Right Baseline correction (F. Rich's MFIT procedure) is polynomial fit every half-pass to each component of Delta-B in spacecraft coordinates using only data from region equatorward of DMSP auroral boundary from CEDAR Database.
Calculated using apex-python, which is based on Apex Fortran code available from CEDAR database, uses nearest year epoch.
Calculated using apex-python, which is based on Apex Fortran code available from CEDAR database, uses nearest year epoch.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Modified Apex Geomagnic Local Time (Reference Height 110km)

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Calculated using apex-python, which is based on Apex Fortran code available from CEDAR database, uses nearest year epoch.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Numerical code for auroral region of spacecraft location (1=Equatorial,2=Auroral,3=Polar)

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 0 = No boundary identified, 1 = Equatorward of the auroral zone, 2 = In the auroral zone, 3 = Polar cap

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Figure of Merit for Auroral Boundary Determination

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Typical range 0-4. Less than 2 is suspect..See DMSP CDF user manual for full specification of FOM computation.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Integer representing the orbit of the day, signed by hemisphere (>0 Northern, <0 Southern).

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Orbit start and end determined by crossings of the Apex magnetic equator. Zero for before first equator crossing of the day.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Unit vector in the direction of spacecraft velocity (ram) in geocentric coordintes

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: This is an estimate, based on a spherical trigonometry approach using a great-circle arc between adjacent points (see user manual).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Unit vector across the spacecraft track to the left ( orthogonal to the direction of spacecraft velocity (ram) ) in geocentric coordintes.

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: This is an estimate, based on a spherical trigonometry approach using a great-circle arc between adjacent points (see user manual).
